title: Task 47

question.text: Which sentence correctly uses the demonstrative pronoun this?

answers.answer: Those is my pen on the table.
answers.feedback: This is used for singular nouns. Look for a sentence where "this" points to a single item or idea.

answers.answer: This are my books on the shelf.
answers.feedback: This is used for singular nouns. Look for a sentence where "this" points to a single item or idea.
This is used for singular nouns. Look for a sentence where "this" points to a single item or idea.

description: The demonstrative pronoun this is used to refer to a singular noun that is close to the speaker, both in terms of distance and in terms of the topic of conversation. It can refer to both tangible objects and intangible ideas or situations.
